required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mode of Delivery on Newborn Hearing Test
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Mode of Delivery on Automated Auditory Brainstem Response (AABR) Test

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
Neonatal hearing screening may fail due to some perinatal and neonatal factors. It is well known that false positivity increases cost and maternal anxiety and anxiety in the neonatal hearing screening. The effect of the type of delivery to hearing screening is not yet clear. The first automated mode of delivery of babies born in Turkey auditory brainstem response (SAD's), the authors aimed to evaluate the effects of the test results and false positive rate.
newborns were evaluated with brainstem response test. The AABR test was performed before patients were discharged. Perinatal and neonatal variables and AABR test results were recorded retrospectively.

primary_outcome.description: hearing test results of newborns. The test results will be grouped according to the type of birth. The effect of the type of delivery on hearing test results will be investigated. The relationship between vaginal route and cesarean section and hearing test will be the first results. hearing test results were evaluated separately for the right and left ear as 'passed the test' and 'left test'.

study_pop.textblock: The patients who gave birth in our hospital and who had a hearing test in their newborns will form the study group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- records of birth process and
- pregnancy test results of newborns.
Exclusion Criteria:
- newborn;
- She was in a neonatal intensive care,
- congenital / chromosomal anomaly,
- undergoing congenital cmv infection,
- facial / ear deformity,
- families with hearing problems,
- those with hyperbiliromyemia,
- <12 hours after delivery,
- maternal infection,
- dm,
- recurrent abortion,
- smoking,
- plesanta previa,

facility.name: Kanuni Sultan Süleyman Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: principal investigator, M.D, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology
